website_summaries.verdict: The 1/2-inch ceramic plate makes this flat iron the ideal travel companion, especially with the dual voltage feature, which allows for worldwide use.
pros: The small plate width makes this ideal for shorter hair
Can achieve a decent maximum temperature of 450 degrees Fahrenheit
Travel-ready with dual voltage for worldwide use
cons: Not ideal for long hair due to smaller surface area and overall size

customer_reviews.title: Not for Fine/Thin Hair
customer_reviews.text: The heating plates on this flat iron have a gap so if you have thin/fine hair, it will not grab the hair and straighten it evenly. I thought it was a random problem, but this is the second flat iron I ordered. If the plates did match up flat, then it would have been the perfect travel flat iron.
customer_reviews.author: JULIE CHRISTINE MARTIN

customer_reviews.title: Great travel product
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Purchased this for a trip to New Zealand and Australia. So much more compact and light weight than your standard straightening iron. The dual voltage is built in so I did not have to purchase a converter. Although smaller than my normal flat iron, the blades are still large enough that it only took me about 5 extra minutes to flat iron my hair (I have long (8-10 inches past my shoulders) medium thick hair). Included a photo to show the size. Would absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Vance

customer_reviews.title: Pulls/Snags Hair - Sad sad sad
customer_reviews.text: First trip I used this on, today. Sadly too late for return it appears on Amazon. Flat iron doesn’t open very wide to slide small thin section of hair into. Biggest issue: the front part of flat plate pulls/snags hair as if it has a grate as you pull hair through to flatten. I have owned larger BaByBliss Titanium flat irons for years and loved them, but this is a never to be used again product. You can hear it snagging/scraping as you pull through - argh!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Compact and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this one inch straightener for my 14 year old daughter; she loves it. I wouldn't recommend it for long, thick hair. It wouldn't be impossible, but it may be a bit impractical. Although, I think there's an exception for traveling. This compact iron is lightweight (just over a pound). The titanium plates heat up quickly and remains hot. It's comfortable to hold and thoughtfully designed. It's a little champion.
customer_reviews.author: OregoniansTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Amazing flat iron!
customer_reviews.text: This flat iron is amazing! It is so small it almost looks like a flat iron for a doll. Don't let the size fool you. I have medium thick, naturally curly hair and this iron had no problem getting all of my hair straight. If you are used to a flat iron, you should have no problem using this. This is the best flat iron for traveling, the gym, or stashed in your desk at work. I would highly recommend this flat iron.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Loved how it feels after i used it on my ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved how it feels after i used it on my blow dried hair. Very smooth straight and no frizz... Def recommended
customer_reviews.author: Alma Santander

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Very small, more appropriate for short hair. Cute and does operate as expected. I love my full size and wanted a smaller version for travel. Yes, I have short hair so this is a perfect addition to my haircessories!
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Little miracle worker
customer_reviews.text: I love this lil flat iron. I was a little skeptical about purchasing this item but it does such a wonderful job straightening my hair with one pass. I have curly hair and never blow dry it straight; trying to limit the amount of heat exposure. With my hair curl type, I can early wear my hair curly for a couple of days and then brush or comb it out and simply run a flat iron. I cut my hair into a bob and it gets all my little hairs perfectly. Good luck! I can't wait to travel with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine247365

customer_reviews.title: O la-la I love it
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today! The 1 inch takes up a good portion of your hair.. Compare that to the one inch flat iron by babyliss. I really liked this because it heat up quickly and left my hair shiny and extreamly straight! I have used babyliss before and this mini one is exactly just like it! I loved it! Worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Maya A.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have used many flat irons, but this is the first that does nothing for my hair. I don’t think it heats up high enough. It was a complete waste of money, I’d send it back, but I ripped the package opening it.

customer_reviews.title: Hot, it gets REALLY hot...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for work on my clients with very short hair - this small iron makes it really ideal for getting the hair line and roots close to the ears and just behind them. Would not repurchase. USE HEAT PROTECTANT / THERMAL SHIELD PRODUCT WITH THIS IRON - it gets way too bloody hot, like plasma hot. Ridiculous. Careful where you grip this iron while using - you can and will burn your hand trying to touch the little rubber grips that I assume are supposed to make it safe to grip while hot. I love Babyliss I have all my professional barber gear & their full size flat irons but I am not entirely pleased with this specific item.
customer_reviews.author: Psahvrin

customer_reviews.title: A girl go to between hair appointment
customer_reviews.text: Love them: Easy to handle for my short style, heat very well. The best part I can toss them in any over night case and don't take up alot of room. Great traveling size.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Only plus - it's dual voltage. Returning it.
customer_reviews.text: I am sad to say that this was a big disappointment. I have the regular Babyliss Pro Nano Titanium 1' and love it, so I thought I would buy the mini one as my travel straightener. This is not like the 1' I have. It doesn't make my hair smooth like the 1' and if anything, it adds fly-always and frizz to the top layer of my hair. I have used the BabyLiss Pro Nano Titanium for more than 10 years now, so I don't understand how they can make this product so inferior to the 1'. It is dual voltage. That is a plus, but that's it. Returning it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: AngelicaInWonderland

customer_reviews.title: Great product for quick touchups or short hair.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mini iron and the full size one of the same brand. It heats up quick, my hair doesn't get caught in it and it's easy to use because it's small. I have thick, coarse hair so, I mostly use the large iron for styling, and this one for touch ups. It's too much work to use this iron for my whole head. Both irons impart a nice shine and do what you'd expect. I had a Chi iron before this and the plastic switch broke. Had I known that this was such a great product, I would've thrown away the Chi iron and bought this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Dee

customer_reviews.title: Not Effective
customer_reviews.text: I am headed to Europe in less than a month and thought this would be a great addition. I straighten my hair every day. First, this product is TINY (just like the description states). The size is awesome for traveling. I didn't love that I couldn't control the heat, but I was willing to live with it for a short time. The problem is that the plates don't touch so it doesn't grab your hair correctly. My hair just looked frizzy after I was done. I didn't want to waste any space in my luggage so I returned it. I was really hoping this would work!
customer_reviews.author: Kylie S

customer_reviews.title: Pulled my hair— awful product
customer_reviews.text: Terrible piece of junk! It pulled my hair and I had to buy another flat iron while on vacation. It is cheaply made and feels like a fake!
customer_reviews.author: lisa vogel

customer_reviews.title: but it works great. I bought it to travel to Italy since ...
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised when I got the curling iron how small it was and wasn't sure if it was going to work on my longer hair, but it works great. I bought it to travel to Italy since I'm doing carry on, I want to cut down on products to bring. This is going to work out great, and I should have my hair shorter when I leave for my trip, so it should work even better. Great product, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: RoseMary LaCosse

customer_reviews.title: No way to adjust the heat
customer_reviews.text: I like the size, but I did not realize their is no dial to adjust the heat.
customer_reviews.author: D. Triche

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad purchase for the right person
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect if you have fine, thin hair. It is very compact and would definitely work but with having thick course hair it really does not help. The heat only goes to 430 and with my hair I have to have something hotter. I wouldn't say this is not a bad purchase for the right person but just didn't work for me which was a little sad as I liked how compact the product is. Was hoping to have it for my camper.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby C

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: My friend recommended this brand and I took a chance ordering the "mini" ... I love it ! No regrets.... This straightener is AMAZING! Portable and lightweight ... I have super thin, shoulder length curly hair and it works fantastic. My hair looks healthier compared to what it looks like when I use my old straightener.... very happy I bought this product! It basically just turns on and off, no dial to change the temp...
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not The Regular Baybliss
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realize that this version of the BayBliss flat iron is mini sized. As you can see from the picture, it fits in the palm of my hand. It’s more suited for last minute touch-ups on the go then for everyday use. The most surprising thing about it is the unit doesn’t have temperature control so you’ll need to be very careful to use a heat protectant on your hair and to use quick even passes over the hair when pressing it to help avoid heat damage.
customer_reviews.author: Golden Jones

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase
customer_reviews.text: I just bought another of these because I dropped and broke a piece off my last one. I tried to order another brand but the heat on this one is much higher so it is easier to straighten my hair. I have short hair so I like the small iron to get the short hairs but I also have thick hair so this makes it easy to be able to straighten it in a few runs rather than trying to pin up all my tiny hairs to get each section done well. I'll stick with this iron for as long as it remains great!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M Sherer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this straightener for international travel and I’m so glad I did. It was extremely easy to pack and use while traveling. The heat resistant case meant I could straighten my bangs and immediately toss the straightener into the case and then into my luggage without having to worry about it damaging my belongings. I now use this straightener for weekend trips and even daily touch ups for my bangs. If you’re looking to straighten all of your hair, this might not be the best tool for you, however, for short, fine hair or for bangs it’s a great product. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Heely

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Mini Flat Iron
customer_reviews.text: I have thick, natural curly shoulder length hair. After reading the product description and reviews I was a little hesitant to buy this straightening iron as I wasn't sure how it'd do on my thick hair. I divided my hair into smaller sections than I normally do when ironing and I got very nice results. This is the perfect size travel iron. I like that it is dual voltage as we will be traveling overseas. Very pleased with how this worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: SamMom

customer_reviews.title: Best Product of its Kind
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Babyliss products for a long time and find them reliable and true to description. I am returning this particular one ONLY because I already have this size and needed the 1/2" for shorter hairline. My Bad ! This is a great compact size making it easy to handle when it is hot. Really does an excellent job of straightening my curly and sometimes FRIZZY hair, Agh ! Purchased thru Prime, one day late on delivery though they obviously made every effort getting it to me. For that, I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sun Sea Surf

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT, WORKS WONDERFULLY!
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderfully!!!! And Babyliss is a totally expensive brand so I was thrilled to find this one on Amazon. Don't be dismayed by the size, for naturally curly hair ladies looking to straighten their coils I highly recommend it. You will have to flat iron small sections of hair anyhow...so why not get this high end one, it does the same exact thing as the larger version at over $100. Gave it to my daughter as I will not be flat ironing my curly locs ever again. She is super thrilled and loves it...she uses it roughly once or twice over a two week period.
customer_reviews.author: BahaQueen

customer_reviews.title: Love it!! Where has this been during all my vacations??!!
customer_reviews.text: How I love this for travel! Returned the pricey and smaller DryBar iron for this one. Larger plate, higher heat and auto dual voltage is awesome. My friend brought a converter for her flat iron and it didn’t work. She ended up using my Babyliss instead. I have below shoulder lenghth hair; takes a bit longer to do but the small size and lightweight features make this an excellent trade off still! Heats up fast when I need to get going in the morning, and cools down fast when its time to pack and leave. No converter needed, just a Type C adapter for Germany, France and Holland; and a Type J adapter for Switzerland. HIGHLY recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer💫

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a legit fan. i’ve tried other mini flat irons and they are all miserable. this is the first one that actually work. i have thick course asian hair and this only needed one pass. i recommend the 1 in over the 1/2 in. i travel a lot and i hate lugging around my large flat iron so i’m super excited to have found this!
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: Small But Mighty!
customer_reviews.text: My hair dresser suggested that I get the regular size flat iron which she uses in her salon. It was cost prohibitive so I got this small version. Don’t be fooled by its size. When you use it, you realize that the handle of full-sized irons are truly needless. I am a petite woman with small hands (and very curly hair. Now I let my hair dry naturally, use the Babybliss in thin sections, hot curlers for five minutes and I am set! A sure purchase!
customer_reviews.author: AnnC

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for a short trip
customer_reviews.text: Positives: Works with adapters for European travel Works good enough for travel (especially for thinner hair) Small and compact, yet wider plates than most travel straighteners Negatives: Takes FOREVER to straighten my hair that is pretty thick and slightly longer than shoulder length. Luckily I also had a hair dryer and would dry my hair as straight as possible first. I also only wash my hair every 3 days. I can’t imagine spending an hour or more straightening my hair every day with this. If you have thick wavyish/curly hair like me, you likely won’t be able to get your hair perfectly straight unless you spend hours on it. No temperature control - only one temperature (just an on/off switch)
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for traveling abroad
customer_reviews.text: Spent 10 days in Italy and needed a packable, duo-voltage straightener for my fine, very long hair. I agonized over whether to bring one; then which one to buy. I read nightmare stories about flat irons melting when used abroad. NO issue here. This baby was well-priced, handled the job like a pro (using some Moraccanoil spray to protect my hair) and didn't mell. It had full capacity heat and all we needed was a simple plug adapter. Definite thumbs-up.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa T

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product!
customer_reviews.text: This flatiron doesn’t heat up enough for me! When I run the iron through my hair it grabs the hair and pulls it. It doesn’t glide through smoothly and is not worth a penny spent on it. My mom has a conair one that works just as well. This is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: cupcakeyum

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good straightener
customer_reviews.text: I have shoulder length hair and needed this for my trip to Asia. I had gone without it last time and my hair was a messed due to the humidity there. So this time, I bought this and it kind of helped taming my hair, but it's so small so it's taking a little longer to style my unruly hair. Overall, it got the job done and also it's dual voltage for countries with different voltage than US. B+ is my score for this straightener.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear

customer_reviews.title: Works nearly as well as my full-sized one!
customer_reviews.text: Great travel flat iron with dual voltage that did not blow my converter and is wide enough to work nearly as well as my full-sized one. Sure, it takes a few more swipes to do everything, but it is a completey practical alternative to the hassle of bringing a full-sized one or dealing with leaving it at home for your trips. Previously I got another ConAir model that was .75” wide and it makes a BIG different having the 1” wide plates.
customer_reviews.author: hunter_aran

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the size
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for the size. It's small enough to pack into my luggage easily (about half the length of my regular straightener) and heats up very quickly. I'll admit that due to the size you have to be the tiniest bit careful about your hand placement, and there's nothing fancy like a balancer so that the heat doesn't touch the surface when you put it down, but it's a great straightener for travel and the color is nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: SillyE

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfect size for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect size for traveling, but since it is so small there is no place to hold the tool at both ends. It is good for short hair, but be careful of letting it stay too long in the hair. It will make tight, frizzy curls. I'm still learning how to use it and will take it traveling for sure. But I'm trying to figure out the blissful place to curl with body, but not get frizzy curls. It's the first iron I've used; I've been a curling iron person forever. But I'm confident. The product itself is very good quality and heats quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Reader

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful travel size. I owned a much bigger and expensive iron for many years but it recently stopped working. I’m retired and travel so I was looking for a smaller iron that would do as good a job as my older one. This one does the job. Doesn’t have the bells and whistles as my old on but the platinum surface makes a big difference. I have a lot of thick, treated hair that gets frizzy because of the humidity on the Gulf Coast where I live.
customer_reviews.author: Pattie

customer_reviews.title: Not as powerful as it's larger models and the heat fluctuates too much
customer_reviews.text: Having very short hair I thought this 1/2" would be great. I have had that larger BabylissPRO Nano Titanium for going on 6 years and it is consistently amazing! This one is probably good for touch ups or something, but I wouldn't suggest it for a full head of even short hair. The grips are too close to the heat which I saw in another comment as well, and the tool gets extremely hot and then cools down to just warm and doesn't really get very hot again. My hair usually straightens very well but this left my hair puffy. Returned to seller and sticking to my larger tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Iron
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this for a lengthy trip to Europe where I packed everything in a backpack. It is dual voltage so I didn't need to worry about buying a converter (just an adapter), and the straightener is very small so it added almost no weight to my backpack. This is the smaller version of my regular straightener so I assumed it would work great and it did. I would recommend getting the 1 inch plate opposed to the 1/2 inch just for time saving purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Ceh0177

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for a tiny product
customer_reviews.text: This thing is tiny. When I opened it I was shocked and thought it was a joke. I was going to return it. But I decided to try it out since I wouldn't be able to get another one in time for some pictures I was having done. Omg. This is way better than the older one I had that was recently broken. It only needed one pass through my hair and was so quick.
customer_reviews.author: SMN

customer_reviews.title: Look no further for a mini flat iron!
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing this mini I went with another brand here on Amazon that was highly rated- BAD IDEA. It was so terrible. This Babyliss one is perfect!! It actually gets the job done and your hair looks good after it, not frizzed out or damaged. The only thing that I don't like about it but not a huge problem, is that the "on and off" switch light doesn't light up well on mine. You can't tell whether it's on or off, unless you have the lights off in the room. So I would always just make sure to actually switch off when you're done, or unplug immediately- don't rely on the light :)
customer_reviews.author: jme03

customer_reviews.title: BaByliss PRO Nano Titanium Mini Straightening
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for overseas travel with the dual voltage. The reason for the 3 stars is the non adjustable heat setting of 400 degrees. Would have burnt my fine color treated hair.
customer_reviews.author: linda moran

customer_reviews.title: Perfect baby flat iron
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this flat iron just for my bangs as they automatically curl under like some 1980's wanna be hairdo and im not havin' it. Works great! However, then I cut my hair just above my shoulders with layers and it work's perfectly for the 'beachy' waves that are now in style. The only down side is that it doesn't have temp control it's preset to 430 degrees and an on off switch but I haven't had any problems. It's titanium and that is great for hard to curl hair which mine is.
customer_reviews.author: A. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: The size is perfect for travel and it gets really hot really fast
customer_reviews.text: The size is perfect for travel and it gets really hot really fast. I only give it 4 stars for two reasons - for one, the plates don't seem to be as 'slick' as other flat irons; they don't slide over my hair as smoothly as I'd like. Second, there is no temperature control which isn't a deal breaker since I like my flat irons really hot but every now and then it's helpful to turn the temp down. Still the best travel straightener ever!
customer_reviews.author: Ava

customer_reviews.title: This little iron did the job
customer_reviews.text: I got this great little straightener for a trip to the UK this year. It was perfect. It is small and light weight so it did not add a lot of weight to my carry on bag. I only took a carry on so size an weight was an issue. Also no problem with TSA bag screening process. It does not have heating controls but all I had to do was switch it off if I thought it was getting to hot and continue with straightening my hair. I have below the shoulder length hair .
customer_reviews.author: SaraC

customer_reviews.title: Good flat iron
customer_reviews.text: I use this mini flat iron to work with my bangs and shorter hair. The only drawback is that there is only an on and off switch and no way to control how much heat you are applying to your hair. It's a good quality flat iron for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy SumnerTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: This is a travel size straightener, so don't expect lots of options, but it works great for my needs. It's small and lightweight, so is perfect for travel. It's small enough to fit into backpack or large purse. I would not recommend it as an every day straightener since the heated area is small and it doesn't have heat controls. But if you only straighten occasionally or need it for travel, this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jen C

customer_reviews.title: Good for bangs
customer_reviews.text: Amazing if you have bangs! That’s all I use this for bc it’s so small. It makes the rest of my hair staticky but bangs look great! It’s the size of a hand! The default temperature is around 400°F or 450°F I believe! (& you can’t change the temperature) it does get pretty hot after about 10 minutes so use quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Hayley Hinkle

customer_reviews.title: Works on short hair
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this smaller iron because a 1" is too wide and clumsy for my short hair. This works great, with just a couple minor issues. The iron does not close completely, so if you have very fine hair, it probably won't hold it while you straighten it. Also, there is not any part at the top of the iron to hold it. The entire iron gets hot, so it is definitely a one handed tool. Great size for traveling or for short hair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I have short thin hair and it doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my trip to Germany next month. Dual voltage. No need to toggle the voltage. Automatically recognizes it. Works great. I have short thin hair and it doesn't fry it at all. Work quickly as the temperature is one setting. I feel that if it works well with my thin and fine hair, without burning it, that's a great sign. It's tiny. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: harrump

customer_reviews.title: Works great with no pulling of hair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this straightener for my upcoming trip. It's really nice to have it small and compact. I have tested it out a couple of times already and it works really well with straightening out my curly hair. It doesn't take long for it to heat up and doesn't get too hot (Just as long as it's not used for a long time or sitting on for a long time). I still wish there was a temp control but that is just personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Brook Fry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Travel size - not as perfect as full size Nano
customer_reviews.text: BaByliss Pro is a great product. Yes, it costs more but you get what you pay for. The only reason I rate this product a 4 star is this travel size does not heat enough, nor is it long enough for my curly Italian hair. :) I thought this would be a great product to pack for my travels, but I'm stuck with carrying the full size Babyliss Nano....which works perfectly on my hair.
customer_reviews.author: Backer

customer_reviews.title: updated review
customer_reviews.text: The heating element heats up and melts the plastic part of the iron. It leave blue pieces in my hair when I use it. I would give it zero stars if I could. Would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: advidshopper

customer_reviews.title: Works ok but doesn’t save enough space in luggage for something more difficult to style my hair.
customer_reviews.text: Bought on recommendation of friend that uses hers for travel so she can keep baggage at a minimum. It is small but I get better styling results using my full size flat iron. I have short hair, suspect it would be even more difficult to use with longer hair. My full size flat iron does not take up too much room in luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: ... didn't want to pay for the full size but loved having my hair straightened at the salon with this ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to pay for the full size but loved having my hair straightened at the salon with this brand so I got the mini and it's been perfect for my shoulder length hair. I can have beautifully straightened hair within 10 minutes. Heats up fast.
customer_reviews.author: PolishGalore

customer_reviews.title: Great little flat iron for travel to Italy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little guy for a trip to Italy. It worked there! I just used an adapter for the wall plug and it worked perfectly! I was worried that it wouldn't automatically switch from 110 (US) to 220 (Italy) but it did. It was a hot little sucker, and you can't control the temperature, but it worked very well if I worked fast. The outside does get a little hot, but there are rubber spots to put your fingers so they don't burn. A great little flat iron for travel
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a trip to England due to needing a dual voltage straightener. It’s small so gets close to the scalp and is better for straightening baby hairs, however that’s the only pro I found. It has zero heat control and is set to 440, which seems unnecessarily hot. It fried my ends and took forever to straighten all my hair due to compact size.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing 😞
customer_reviews.text: I did really like this straightener . It worked really well until it completely went out on me while I was in the middle of doing my hair the other night and will no longer turn on. I only had it for 3 months that's a shame don't spend your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love Love my Baby Bliss!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for me for my medium length hair. It does exactly what I want to. It's a great little travel hot iron.. doesn't take up much room at all. This is probably the best one I've had. It heats up quickly. There are no heat adjustments but for me it is not an issue. I don't have really thick or long hair, so it is great! Not sure for someone with long or thick hair...
customer_reviews.author: Valann

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Straightener for International Travel
customer_reviews.text: I travel to Europe often and this straightener is now a staple in my packing list. I have used it in Italy, Germany, Austria, GB & Ireland without any issues; you just need the appropriate travel adaptors. I love how small it is for packing and it's perfect to use on my medium length wavy hair. I imagine it may not work as well for curly hair since it does not get extremely hot and there is only an on/off setting (no temperature presets).
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Great travel flat iron!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a trip to Europe, and am so happy I got it! This is a great little iron - heats up quickly, and works extremely well. It is very small and light, easy to transport, and it was great that the voltage switched automatically. I used it both in the States and in Europe, and it worked perfectly in both places. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: g

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel but gets hot!
customer_reviews.text: I used this when we took our trip to Ireland last year. It's small and didn't take up much room in my suitcase. I have thin short hair and it straightened my hair quickly however my only complaint is that it gets very hot. I had to put a towel underneath so the counter/table wouldn't burn. Other than that, it worked well with my hair. Be careful using it because you may burn your fingers or the counter!
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Great little gadget
customer_reviews.text: Great little gadget! Everything rolled up is no bigger than half you hand. I have chest length hair and I've used it to straighten it all in a pinch but I wouldn't suggest buying it for that use. The exterior seems to get a bit hotter than I expected and there isn't much protection for the fingers that are gripping the outside of it. If you're using it to straighten some fly-aways or bangs then it's just what you need
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very good for short hair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do my nieces hair. It works well the only issue is there are no temp settings, just an ON and OFF button. But the package tells you that it does not heat up past 400 degrees so i assume once it is on it will go up to that temp. Good value and works great for edges and short hair.
customer_reviews.author: Domonique

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect flat iron for travel. Small and lightweight. I have long, thick hair that gets frizzy in humid, rainy areas. This kept my hair straight and manageable. It did take about 30 minutes longer to straighten my hair vs my 4 in flat iron, but was worth the time. Big bonus was compatibility with different voltages. Especially since bought primarily for trip to Europe. Worked like a charm. Did not burn my hair.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Raines

customer_reviews.title: Great little travel mini
customer_reviews.text: We have the full size but for some reason they only make the mini dual voltage. This worked well but with 3 girls and long thick hair it took a while to get it all done...2 weeks in Italy was a lot of straightening with this little thing! . Great travel one just wish they made the full size dual voltage too
customer_reviews.author: Sarah B

customer_reviews.title: Great for use in EU or US
customer_reviews.text: Works great in both EU AMS US. Would like a way to control temp and add a bit of curl but for the cost and quality it was a great buy. My hair dresser gave me a tip that worked great to lower the temp (wet a wash towel and run the blades across / between the wet towel until the iron stops sizzling then use in hair. Repeat every couple of pulls.
customer_reviews.author: ALoni

customer_reviews.title: Love my mini!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is wonderful! Because my hair is on the short side, I have some trouble with a full size straightening iron touching the back of my neck and burning me. This baby is small enough to use without getting burned, and works just as well as the full size (in fact, better, because I can get into smaller sections of hair).
customer_reviews.author: Anne Gaul

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but mighty
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. Quick little flips are super easy. You’re not flattening your whole head with this, to be sure, it’s tiny. But for quick bang fixes or end flips it’s perfect. Worked great in Ireland with a plug adapter (not converter), but it got real hot real fast. The pouch is nice. I just stick the body in the pouch and wrap the cord around the outside.
customer_reviews.author: DRZ Mama

customer_reviews.title: Cute and functional
customer_reviews.text: I dont regret buying it. I travel atleast 3 to 4 times a year and this is a great product. Its small, handy, and cute but it works really well. It straighthens my hair fast and works great. It takes a little bit longer for me to use since my hair is so thick other than that it works great. Its fits my luggage and doesnt take too much space
customer_reviews.author: wAtchAdOinSeXy08

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a regular size BaByliss flat iron for years and I love it. This little one just didn't straighten hair very well. I had to keep going over and over many times, but it still looked frizzy. I have medium thickness hair, shoulder length. I'll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: iblum

customer_reviews.title: Beware the lack of temp adjustment
customer_reviews.text: I walked into this as someone who thought I could manage some control since it didnt have a heat adjustment, but it ended up really damaging my already really damaged hair WHILE I WAS USING A HEAT PROTECTANT. Overall, I gave it a good review because it came pretty quickly and well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Zombified

customer_reviews.title: Buy this
customer_reviews.text: I love this straightener. I use it on my daughter’s hair which is thick and curly. It takes me about 20 minutes to do her full head. Hands down the only straightener that leaves her hair smooth and straight.
customer_reviews.author: Badbechmamabear

customer_reviews.title: its ok but the product could be better...
customer_reviews.text: The flat iron is awesome,works as promised.My only complaint is the cord. Its very thin and while you are doing your hair the cord gets extremely tangled. With that being that i am not sure i can recommend it . i gave only one star for the temperature control because you can't change the setting.
customer_reviews.author: bettina grube

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this flat iron. I am natural with thick medium length hair. I only pass through my hair once and it glides very easily. I have not had any burning with this product, with my heat protector.The only thing i dont like is the pre set temp. Of 400 degress fahrenheit.
customer_reviews.author: Raye

customer_reviews.title: Superior quality
customer_reviews.text: This mini iron is perfect for short hair. Very well made, excellent quality. At first I thought it was taking a bit too long to heat, but now it seems fine and I am very glad I kept it. Don't be tempted by the less expensive mini irons, as the quality is far inferior to the Babyliss. You get what you pay for. I have already bought a second one for my travel tote.
customer_reviews.author: JKW

customer_reviews.title: Feared to Cleared
customer_reviews.text: I was worried after watching reviews online that the product was going to be too hot to use on my short hair since it only heats up to one temperature, but I've used it a couple of times now, and it's pretty great. It doesn't get too hot, and it's so tiny it's going to be great for my vacation trip. The finger pads make it very easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: ShMeDa

customer_reviews.title: First Time user and in love!
customer_reviews.text: I love how small it is and convenient for traveling. It is thin enough that I actually use it to enhance my curls (who would have thought a straightener for curls?). I use a heat protector and that is all. It really goes hot very fast and it does not damage my hair
customer_reviews.author: Antonieta

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous. A bit of a burn hazard.
customer_reviews.text: I understand the hype about this. I am black and have texturized hair (it's really just as thick and unruly as natural hair because I started out with 4c). It got my hair straight and reverted very very slowly for a humid climate. My only complaint is that the top and the bottom of the flat iron (on the other side of the plates) is so poorly insulated that it's really really easy to burn your fingers if they slide too far up. That's pretty easy to do if you're used to a bigger flat iron- because this one is itty bitty. Otherwise, I'm happy. Beats my last flat-iron!
customer_reviews.author: Rhythmseeker

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job but size has drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: I definitely like the size of this hair iron. As expected, this can not replace a full size one. I also noticed that it catches some hair while I go through it. Its perfect for backpacking and when I just want to smooth out my hair but it will take twice as long to straighten my mid length hair compared to a full size hair iron.
customer_reviews.author: Feona S.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive little flat iron
customer_reviews.text: Wanted this little flat iron for so long and finally got myself to purchase it. It get extremely hot so you need to be careful so it doesn't fry your hair. I'm impressed what a great job it does for how small the iron is. BaByliss is a great brand and can't go wrong. Only thing I wish it had was an auto timer and a heat setting, other than that I love it!
customer_reviews.author: J.M

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected??
customer_reviews.text: I am so not a fan!!! I actually bought a cheaper brand at Wal-Mart that works better than the Nano mini. My hair is natural with no chemicals color treated... I used it yesterday and my hair feels really dry. The brand from Wal-Mart works better. I will be returning this product soon!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only for shorter, thinner hair.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this from reading the reviews and for my trip to Europe with a carry on. I have a lot of thick, long hair and I tried using, but hair to thick and would have had to spend hours separating. If you have thin or short, shoulder length hair this might work. Heat didn’t feel hot and just didn’t work. I will give to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: Not something I would recommend. It is VERY small. Doesn't heat up very well and takes at least 5-7 strokes just to get my wavy hair to straighten. Also, not good if you have a lot of hair or thick. I would return if I didn't hold onto it for so long. Waste of $30...
customer_reviews.author: Erika Kalpakoff

customer_reviews.title: Nice portable flat iron, but not a smooth glide
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and small so perfect for traveling. The only small drawback is that it does not glide as smoothly as the manufacturer claims. Larger flat irons seem to glide much smoother. Still, if you want the portability, this smoothness issue isn't a huge problem, and this is your best option.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Great product if you are used to using a straightening iron
customer_reviews.text: This is my first straightening iron; I have never used one in my life and I am still skeptical if I'll burn my hair. Having said that, it works - probably would work better if I kept my hair longer in the grip (but I am afraid) It's really small so it is easy to pack when going on a trip
customer_reviews.author: Lunchtimerunner

customer_reviews.title: Great for bangs!
customer_reviews.text: I use this almost daily for my bangs. It's absolutely perfect for those stray hairs that dry really weird after showering. Just the right size to carry around in a backpack/big purse to take to the office for touch ups too. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okayish
customer_reviews.text: This flat iron is teeny which is great for traveling. It works well enough especially for my tiny "baby" hairs, however, it's not very good for the rest of your hair unless you do VERY small portions of your hair. My hair is short (above shoulders) and I still have to use my regular iron in order to get a good straight finish. Not a bad tool but still have to use your big flat iron.
customer_reviews.author: KY Acton

customer_reviews.title: Plates don't touch
customer_reviews.text: I realize that it's a mini and may not deserve to be held to the same standard as a full-sized flat iron, but the fact that (at least with the one I received) the plates don't close means that this isn't worth the admittedly inexpensive price, at least for me. I have short hair (i.e. a couple of inches long at most) and assumed that a flat iron with a small plate would serve me better than one that had plates as long as my hair, but it's proving difficult to find one that's a half inch and isn't cheaply built.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best purchase I have ever made! Needed travel size hair tools for international travel and this straightener exceeded my expectations. The plate is the standard size for regular size straighteners and it gets to a high temperature for a style that will last all day. I even curl my hair using this product and it works just as well. Definitely recommend the brand as I have the travel dryer as well.
customer_reviews.author: Abbey B Webb

customer_reviews.title: Love this mini flat iron
customer_reviews.text: Works great it is definitely great for straighting edges and small portions of hair. I would not recommend for large sections or long length hair. Perfect for short hair styles.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Small, handy, and hot!
customer_reviews.text: My hair stylist recommended this product to me. I have very naturally curly short hair and this tiny straightener gets very close to my scalp and straightens very well. It gets very, very hot and sometimes it is uncomfortably warm in my hand but tolerable its purpose. It packs very well because it is so, so tiny. This is nice for touch ups and short hair but I'd think twice if you have long, thick hair. It's a good price for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Great brand worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great for traveling! This brand is the best! I had the full size I purchased 15 yrs ago for a lot of money and it just broke on me recently. This was a great price for a great brand!
customer_reviews.author: Sandralikes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for travel and short hair. If you have long thick hair I would not recommend as it will take a long time to straighten. No need to go over and over same selection if hair, one swipe gives you a pin straight no frizz look.
customer_reviews.author: Chad & Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Close access to roots
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for close to scalp access. Temp control works great. I have naturally curly hair and this iron gets hot enough for a naturally straight look
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for shorter hair
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this little flat iron. In the past I've used the instyler as I never had much luck with flat irons and felt it always pulled my hair. I have since cut my hair short and the instyler is to large. A friend has this and recommended it, it's perfect fort shorter hair and really like how fast it heats up and very easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Okay - this is what you want to buy for European travel. You will still need an adaptor but it won't blow things out, it is small and light and inexpensive. Leave your good flat iron at home and buy this for Europe. It runs a tad hotter than my full size one and there is no beep to tell you when it has reached heat (quickly) nor does it turn itself off. However, this is just splendid for travel abroad. Just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Pictorama

customer_reviews.title: My favorite flat iron
customer_reviews.text: I use this straightener all the time, even when I'm not traveling. It heats up well, it's lightweight, and there's just nothing to complain about here. I love that it's dual voltage, and the 1" thick plate makes it so I don't have to go over the same place a bunch of times. It only has one heat setting, but I always just used the highest setting on my other straighteners anyway, so it works for me.
customer_reviews.author: theresa n.

customer_reviews.title: ... Peru because it has dual voltage and is a nice, small size
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my trip to Peru because it has dual voltage and is a nice, small size. It heats up very quickly and straightens well (I mostly just use it for the baby hairs around my face). The glide isn't as nice as my regular-size CHI straightener, but for the price and convenience of the size, I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Hacker

customer_reviews.title: Works well on short hair
customer_reviews.text: Better for me than more expensive 1 inch flat irons because I have short hair with waves/cowlicks that start close to the root line, and 1 inch iron can’t get to the root of the wave like this small iron can. Works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

product_meta.title: BaBylissPRO BABNT3053N Nano Titanium Mini Straightening Iron
product_meta.description:
Style:Iron| Size:0.5 InchThe BaBylissPRO Nano Titanium Mini Straightening Iron has 1/2" wide plates - it delivers superior heat retention & smoothness in a compact, travel-ready size! Get smooth, shiny beautiful hair from this little star. This mini flat iron has dual voltage for worldwide use & a total length of 6" so you can take it (almost) anywhere! The Nano Titanium plates heat up fast & reach temperatures up to 430F, mini size is perfect for travel or the gym.

BRAND STORY
BaBylissPRO is the world’s leading producer of innovative, high-performance professional styling tools. Chosen by hairdressers, barbers, and clients everywhere, BabylissPRO styling tools are versatile and engineered to last.
